<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
9709/22  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 309, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[732, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
February/March 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 325, 905, 340]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 395, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 228, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 280, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 359, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 866, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 858, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 220, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 384, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 50.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 728, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
Sketch the graph of \(y = \left|3x - 7\right|\), stating the coordinates of the points where the graph meets the axes. [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 432, 143, 450]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 429, 920, 465]]<|/det|>
Hence find the set of values of the constant \(k\) for which the equation \(\left|3x - 7\right| = k(x - 4)\) has exactly two real roots. [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[316, 92, 665, 247]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 260, 920, 303]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y = \sqrt{1 + \mathrm{e}^{0.5x}}\). The shaded region is bounded by the curve and the straight lines \(x = 0, x = 6\) and \(y = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 314, 146, 333]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 314, 920, 348]]<|/det|>
Use the trapezium rule with three intervals to find an approximation to the area of the shaded region. Give your answer correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 329, 920, 348]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 603, 88]]<|/det|>
The shaded region is rotated completely about the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 102, 507, 120]]<|/det|>
Find the exact volume of the solid produced.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 102, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 722, 88]]<|/det|>
Show by calculation that the \(x\)-coordinate of \(P\) lies between 3.8 and 4.0 .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 920, 88]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 442, 181, 460]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[178, 442, 920, 475]]<|/det|>
Use an iterative formula, based on the equation in part (a), to find the \(x\)-coordinate of \(P\) correct to 3 significant figures. Show the result of each iteration to 5 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 459, 920, 477]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[344, 92, 645, 304]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 324, 556, 344]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with parametric equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[351, 355, 648, 375]]<|/det|>
\[x = 1 + \sqrt{t},\qquad y = (\ln t + 2)(\ln t - 3),\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 386, 861, 406]]<|/det|>
for \(0 < t < 25\). The curve crosses the \(x\)-axis at the points \(A\) and \(B\) and has a minimum point \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 433, 144, 451]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 428, 361, 457]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = \frac{4\ln t - 2}{\sqrt{t}}.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 432, 920, 451]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 475, 88]]<|/det|>
Find the exact gradient of the curve at \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 918, 88]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 540, 186, 559]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 536, 411, 556]]<|/det|>
Find the exact coordinates of \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 536, 920, 556]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 99, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 241, 89]]<|/det|>
Prove that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[312, 102, 683, 120]]<|/det|>
\[\sin 2\theta (a\cot \theta +b\tan \theta)\equiv a + b + (a - b)\cos 2\theta ,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 379, 151]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 133, 920, 151]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 92, 146, 111]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 78, 585, 128]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of \(\int_{\frac{1}{12}\pi}^{\frac{1}{6}\pi} \sin 2\theta (5\cot \theta + 3\tan \theta)\mathrm{d}\theta .\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 92, 920, 110]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 504, 181, 523]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 504, 695, 523]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\sin \frac{2}{3}\alpha \big(2\cot \frac{1}{3}\alpha +7\tan \frac{1}{3}\alpha \big) = 11\) for \(-\pi < \alpha < \pi .\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 504, 920, 523]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]
